channel.title: No-Ip problems?
channel.description:
Well, I change my client IP my no-ip...
However, it's not working... I don't have a gui.jar either.
Anyone got a solution?

item.title: No-Ip problems?
item.dc:creator: @chains424 chains424
item.description:
@chains424 wrote:

I’m pretty sure I have,
PortChecker tells me that my ports are open.

Read full topic

item.title: No-Ip problems?
item.dc:creator: @Redemtion Redemtion
item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

[quote=“chains424, post:7, topic:450421”]Tried searching, nothing really there.

I am not getting any errors when compiling.
And no it won’t let me on my server. When I try to log into it, it says "Error Connecting to Server

[Edit]
It only lets me on the server if I use my INTERNAL ip which is ***.*..
The problem is, you are supposed to use your external IP… I believe.

[Edit]
Actually it won’t let me connect if I use my internal or external IP. Won’t connect if I use no-ip…

It only connects to 0.0.0.0[/quote]
When you use your external IP, have you portforwarded correctly?

Read full topic

item.title: No-Ip problems?
item.dc:creator: @chains424 chains424
item.description:
@chains424 wrote:

Tried searching, nothing really there.

I am not getting any errors when compiling.
And no it won’t let me on my server. When I try to log into it, it says "Error Connecting to Server

[Edit]
It only lets me on the server if I use my INTERNAL ip which is ***.*..
The problem is, you are supposed to use your external IP… I believe.

[Edit]
Actually it won’t let me connect if I use my internal or external IP. Won’t connect if I use no-ip…

It only connects to 0.0.0.0

Read full topic

item.title: No-Ip problems?
item.dc:creator: @Redemtion Redemtion
item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

[quote=“chains424, post:5, topic:450421”]There is one other IP in my Client.jar

But I’m not sure if I should change this or not.
I did attempt to change it to my no-ip but it gave me no results.

inputString.length() > 0) { if(myPrivilege == 2 || server.equals("127.0.0.1") || 1 == 1/*to remove*/) {[/quote]
Are you getting errors when you compile? Is it letting you on your server when you changed the ip?
*Edit - Try searching for ‘Adress’ aswell.

Read full topic

item.title: No-Ip problems?
item.dc:creator: @Redemtion Redemtion
item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

[quote=“chains424, post:3, topic:450421”]Oh, probably should have mentioned that.
Sorry for my fail, Lol.

it’s 317 DimeScape Client + Source[/quote]
Try searching in your files for a localhost ip (127.0.0.1, 0.0.0.0). See what pops up, and in which files they’re in. Granted that you have the filesearcher.jar that all sources have now-a-days.

Read full topic
